cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi W of Key West, Florida / 270 mi W of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn N-NW tonight, then N-NE on Wednesday, cross Florida’s Big Bend, and move NE just off the southeast U.S. coast into the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Apalachee Bay)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Big Bend, Georgia, South Carolina, North Carolina Outer Banks, then offshore Atlantic waters
weather_observation.wind: Only a slight (≤3%) chance of brief tropical-storm-force gusts; prevailing winds expected to remain below gale force.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Delaware Bay or the Port of Wilmington.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands could bring 1–2 inches of rain late Friday into Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increased surf and rip-current risk along Delaware and New Jersey beaches over the weekend.
